hero.monitoring: We take full responsibility for your security: we monitor wallets in real time, perform AML checks, audit your system, and provide a personal crypto manager. Quick setup — just one day, no access to your wallets required.

list.title: No real-time transaction monitoring
list.description: Lack of instant transaction notifications is a huge risk. You learn about fund movements only after they occur, when it’s often too late to react. Many companies miss critical information due to the absence of an alerting system. Without a structured process and specialized tools, you can’t monitor fund movements on corporate wallets in real time. This creates a loss of control and increases the consequences of unauthorized operations.

list.title: Receiving and sending high-risk funds
list.description: Insufficient control over the origin of crypto assets opens a direct path for 'dirty' money to enter your operational flow. These include transactions related to fraud, darknet activity, sanctioned entities, and other illegal sources. Lack of AML checks exposes your company to legal and reputational risks.

list.title: Human factor risk
list.description: Your asset security critically depends on a few employees. If private keys and signing rights are concentrated in one person’s hands, and there’s no multisig, role separation, or activity auditing, your company faces a massive risk. Without proper storage and recovery policies, vulnerabilities arise that can lead to irreversible losses.

securityBot.features:
Key advantages:

Multi-chain monitoring: A unified dashboard for all your wallets across EVM, Solana, and Tron networks.

Flexible alerts: Configure triggers based on your risk models — large transactions, operations with suspicious addresses, or abnormal frequency.

Integration: Receive instant notifications via Telegram, Slack, or email.

Automated reporting: Daily reports and seamless integration with Google Sheets for audits and deep financial analysis.

criminalistics.crypto_subtitle: Investigation of thefts and increasing the chances of asset recovery
criminalistics.description: In the event of theft or fraud, we conduct a comprehensive forensic investigation. Our goal is to trace stolen funds, collect evidence, and maximize the chances of recovery.

plans.title: Asset tracing
plans.subtitle: We analyze transaction history to create a detailed map of stolen fund movements across the blockchain.

plans.title: Identification and analysis
plans.subtitle: We determine the final addresses and services to which the assets were withdrawn.

plans.title: Asset labeling
plans.subtitle: We assign a 'stolen' tag to the stolen funds, adding addresses to databases for ongoing monitoring and blocking.

plans.title: Counterparty notification
plans.subtitle: We send official requests to exchanges and other platforms to freeze and document the assets.

plans.title: Legal support
plans.subtitle: We prepare a full documentation package for communication with exchanges, issuers, and law enforcement agencies.

plans.title: Monitoring and support
plans.subtitle: We continuously track the status of stolen assets and keep you informed of investigation progress.

result.title: Result
result.description: You receive a comprehensive investigation report including a transaction map, identified addresses, undertaken actions, and an objective assessment of recovery chances.

questions.title: Do you require access to private keys?
questions.answer: No. Our zero-trust principle means we work exclusively via public addresses, predefined roles, and/or multisig setups — ensuring your assets remain safe.

questions.title: How quickly is SecurityBot connected?
questions.answer: Setup takes about 30 minutes, provided you share wallet addresses and notification channels.

questions.title: Which networks do you support?
questions.answer: We support most major networks, including EVM-compatible ones, as well as Solana and Tron.

questions.title: How is the subscription cost calculated?
questions.answer: Pricing is based on a base tariff and the volume of API requests, directly linked to your transaction count.

questions.title: What does the AML report include?
questions.answer: A full report contains risk scoring, source breakdown, screenshots and links, plus detailed recommendations for next steps.

questions.title: How does the infrastructure audit work?
questions.answer: The process includes interviews, read-only artifact analysis, and a final report with classified risks and a mitigation plan.

questions.title: Who is a crypto manager?
questions.answer: Our crypto manager is an external expert handling all operational tasks: confirming incoming transactions, managing outgoing ones, maintaining logs, and ensuring asset cleanliness.
